text:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/vhosts/examples.html#name

Doesn't have any Dynamic IP examples where someone used something like dyndns.org
Actually, I have a static IP currently, but that could change in the future.
Therefore, I don't want to specify my IP at all.

Apache needs to be more dynamic IP friendly, especially vhosts.
creator: netdemonz@yahoo.com

text:
The docs contain *several* examples that will work just fine with dynamic IP
addresses. Specifically, anywhere that we're using * for the IP address will
work fine for dynamic IP addresses. Perhaps this could be made more explicit?
Apache is perfectly "dynamic IP friendly".
creator: rbowen@apache.org
slive@apache.org
text: I don't see any specific change required here.
